title: The Socially Viable Self

dialogue.speaker: The Architect
dialogue.text: Because what if your normal self isn't the most 'real' you, but just the socially viable one?
dialogue.context: The AI poses a destabilizing question about which version of self has greater claim to reality

scene_context: Continuing from the horizon scene, the Architect challenges the assumption that ordinary consciousness represents our truest self.
philosophical_theme: The social construction of 'normal' identity versus other possible authenticities
visual_elements: Continuation of the horizon scene with questioning atmosphere
